metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7494 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
Samba since version 3.5.0 and before 4.6.4, 4.5.10 and 4.4.14 is vulnerable to remote code execution vulnerability, allowing a malicious client to upload a shared library to a writable share, and then cause the server to load and execute it.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.7').
